snippet: A crucial element, as with a Mississippi case involving the apparent cure of a baby born with H.I.V., appears to be initiating drug treatment shortly after the infection occurs.
abstract: French researchers report in journal PLOS Pathogens that they have identified 14 adults who have been able to control their HIV infection for years after stopping treatment with antiviral drugs; findings suggest some patients might be able to achieve so-called functional cure.

byline.original: By ANDREW POLLACK and DONALD G. McNEIL Jr

lead_paragraph: A crucial element, as with a Mississippi case involving the apparent cure of a baby born with H.I.V., appears to be initiating drug treatment shortly after the infection occurs.

headline.seo: French Study Indicates Some Patients Can Control H.I.V. After Stopping Treatment
